intro: Camassia quamash subsp. utahensis, commonly known as Utah camas, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in meadows and open woodlands. It produces edible bulbs that are historically used by Indigenous peoples. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly smaller size and more compact growth habit compared to the main species.
